metadata.title: US ISO/RTO Electricity Supply Response Data
metadata.author: Bottlenecks Lab
metadata.notes: Prices are 2024 annual averages from ISO market monitor reports. ERCOT, SPP, and ISO-NE are day-ahead averages; MISO and PJM are real-time load-weighted averages; CAISO and NYISO are estimated from available reports. DA prices are typically $1–3/MWh higher than RT. Capacity additions are gross nameplate MW reaching commercial operation in 2024, sourced from EIA-860M January 2026 vintage (not net of retirements). Industry sources report higher figures for some ISOs — see filing-lag notes. Queue completion rates span 2000–2020 entry cohorts from LBNL Queued Up and Brattle/AEU Scorecard; ERCOT uses a narrower 2018–2020 cohort. Project counts are distinct generators (EIA-860M unit-level) reaching COD in 2024. All-in prices add capacity market payments (RPM, FCA, ICAP, RA, PRA) to energy-only wholesale averages.

isos.name: Electric Reliability Council of Texas
isos.qualitative_note: Energy-only market with streamlined interconnection. Added ~14 GW in 2024 (EIA-860M) — more than any other ISO — driven by solar, battery, and gas. Queue completion rate 3–5× higher than peers.

sources.price: E3 2024 ERCOT Market Update (ERCOT North Hub DA avg)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 7,277 / battery 4,264 / wind 1,735 / gas 697 MW). Note: industry sources (E3, IEEFA, Dallas Fed, Amperon) report ~18.7 GW pending final filings.
sources.peak: ERCOT (settled value, Aug 20 2024; below 2023 record of 85.5 GW)

isos.name: Midcontinent ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Largest US ISO by geographic footprint. Solar installations doubled in 2024. Queue reforms (MTEP cycles) improving throughput, but ~72% of projects still never reach fruition.

sources.price: Potomac Economics 2024 MISO State of the Market (RT avg LMP)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 6,273 / wind 625 / gas 186 / battery 54 MW)

isos.name: California ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Battery storage leader — added 3.6 GW of batteries in 2024 (EIA-860M). High additions driven by state mandates, but only ~10% of queue projects reach operation. Duck curve dynamics suppress midday prices.

sources.price: CAISO DMM Q3/Q4 2024 Quarterly Reports (est. annual DA avg)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (battery 3,638 / solar 2,688 / wind 143 / gas 48 MW)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up (2000–2019 cohort); Concentric Energy Advisors; Brattle Scorecard reports <10% for 2018–2020

isos.name: PJM Interconnection
isos.qualitative_note: Largest US ISO by peak demand. Data center load growth outpacing new supply. Queue backlog of 260+ GW with only 12% completion rate. 'Speed to power' crisis identified by RMI.

sources.price: Monitoring Analytics 2024 PJM State of the Market (RT LW avg LMP)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 3,817 / wind 189 / battery 54 MW)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up (2000–2019 cohort); RMI; Brattle Scorecard reports <10% for 2018–2020

isos.name: Southwest Power Pool
isos.qualitative_note: Wind-dominated resource mix with lowest wholesale prices. Modest new additions in 2024 but historically strong wind buildout. Queue reforms underway.

sources.price: SPP 2024 Annual State of the Market Report (DA system avg)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (wind 902 / solar 225 MW). Note: industry sources (SPP ELCC Report, Amperon) report ~2.5 GW pending final filings.
sources.peak: SPP 2024 State of the Market (est. ~3% below 2023)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up (2000–2019 cohort); Brattle Scorecard reports <10% for 2018–2020

isos.name: New York ISO
isos.qualitative_note: Extreme zonal price divergence — NYC (Zone J) averages ~$50+/MWh while upstate ~$25. Minimal new supply despite CLCPA mandates. Offshore wind procurement delays and Article 10 siting friction.

sources.price: NYISO 'Impact of National & Global Conditions on Electricity Prices in New York' white paper (2024 avg wholesale price)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 915 / wind 130 / battery 20 MW)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up (2000–2019 cohort); Brattle Scorecard reports <10% for 2018–2020

isos.name: ISO New England
isos.qualitative_note: Energy + FCA capacity cost ~$51/MWh (comparable basis). Published $87/MWh total includes RECs, RGGI, ancillary, and transmission. Vineyard Wind blade failure (July 2024) shut down all 136 MW for ~6 months; operational contribution in 2024 was severely limited. Gas dependence + pipeline constraints drive winter price spikes. Worst queue completion rate nationally.

sources.price: ISO-NE Internal Market Monitor 2024 Annual Markets Report (DA avg)
sources.capacity: EIA-860M Jan 2026 vintage (solar 421 / gas 65 / battery 25 MW)
sources.queue: LBNL Queued Up (2000–2019 cohort); Brattle/AEU Scorecard reports <10% for 2018–2020
